Happy Feast of Corpus Christi !!!

Today, we celebrate  the Feast of Corpus Christi, a feast encompassing the Eucharistic sacrifice, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the Real Presence of Jesus. It serves to give collective thanks for His abiding presence, instruct us in the Mystery, Faith, and devotion of the Eucharist, and encourage us to embrace this precious gift. We honor God's enduring love as we partake in His body and blood, allowing it to nourish and transform us. May this feast deepen our understanding, strengthen our faith, and foster unity.

HAPPY FEAST OF SAINT GONSALO GARCIA !!!

St. Gonsalo Garcia, O.F.M. The only East Indian saint (Portuguese: Gonsalo Garcia; 1556 ‚Äì 5 February 1597), was a lay brother of the Franciscans, from Portuguese Bombay, Bassein in early modern India and, he died a Christian martyr,  In the 16th-century Shogunate, of Japan; he was canonized a saint, along with his companions, the Twenty-six Martyrs of Japan. He was born at Bassein (Vasai), Bacaim in the Indo-Portuguese era!!!
 
WISHING ALL 'VASAIKARS' A VERY "HAPPY FEAST" OF THE SAINT OF VASAI, ST. GONSALO GARCIA' !!!

HAPPY BIRTHDAY , DEAREST  REV. FR. HILARY FERNANDES ,  MAY OUR BLESSED MOTHER BESTOW YOU WITH GOOD HEALTH AND BLESS YOU WITH MANY MORE YEARS TO COME, SO THAT YOU MAY CONTINUE SPREADING DEVOTION TO VIRGIN MARY THROUGH YOUR MUSIC AND EVERGREEN HYMNS.  

THE HYMN  ‚ÄúFATIMA KUMARI MATA‚Äù  WAS SPECIALLY COMPOSED FOR FATIMA KARJAT BY REV. FR. HILARY FERNANDES,  ( WHO CELEBRATES HIS BIRTHDAY TODAY)  AT THE REQUEST OF REV. FR. CALISTUS FERNANDES . 

REV. FR. CALISTUS FERNANDES SANG THIS  HYMN AND MADE IT POPULAR AMONGST  DEVOTEES OF FATIMA KARJAT DURING HIS TENURE AS RECTOR OF THE SHRINE.

THE SHRINE OF OUR LADY OF FATIMA AT KARJAT IS THE  FIRST TO BE NAMED AND DEDICATED TO OUR LADY OF FATIMA, NOT ONLY IN INDIA, BUT IN ENTIRE ASIA. ‚ÄúIT WAS BUILT IN THE YEAR 1935, & HOUSES THE STATUE  OF OUR LADY OF FATIMA BROUGHT FROM PORTUGAL IN THE YEAR 1920, YEARS BEFORE THE APPROVAL (OF THE FATIMA APPARITIONS) IN 1930 BY THE HOLY SEE‚Äù

LET THIS SONG REACH ALL EAST INDIANS. SO LIKE AND SHARE THIS SONG TO ALL YOUR NEAR AND DEAR ONES. AND ALSO DON'T FORGET TO SUBSCRIBE TO OUR CHANNEL FOR REGULAR UPDATES AND ENJOY MORE BEAUTIFUL HYMNS.

Happy Feast of St. Sebastian !

"Wishing you a blessed and joyful Feast of St. Sebastian! May the grace and strength of the martyr guide you on your journey"
---------------------------------------------

St. Sebastian was a Christian martyr who is remembered for his faith and courage. He is believed to have lived in the 3rd century AD, during the Roman Empire. He is the patron saint of athletes and soldiers, and his feast day is celebrated on January 20th in the Catholic Church.

According to tradition, St. Sebastian was a captain in the Roman army and a secret Christian. When Emperor Diocletian discovered Sebastian's faith, he ordered him to be tied to a stake and shot with arrows. Miraculously, Sebastian survived the execution and was later visited by Saint Irene, who nursed him back to health. However, when Sebastian confronted the emperor and denounced his persecution of Christians, he was clubbed to death.

St. Sebastian is often depicted in art as a handsome young man tied to a tree or stake, and pierced by arrows. His iconography is usually associated with arrows and bows, and he is also depicted as a soldier. He is venerated as a martyr and a protector against plague and disease, and his intercession is invoked for the protection of soldiers and athletes.

The cult of St. Sebastian was very popular throughout the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, and he remains a beloved saint in the Catholic Church today. His feast day is celebrated on January 20th, and many churches, shrines and chapels are dedicated to him around the world.

Celebrate the solemnity of the Assumption of Our Lady with a captivating old traditional hymn, "Assumpsao Saibini"! This enchanting melody will transport you to a realm of profound devotion and belief. Immerse yourself in its beauty and experience the reverence for our Blessed Mother firsthand.

Accompanied by heartfelt lyrics, this rendition of "Assumpsao Saibini" has been uploaded to allow devotees like you to partake in the veneration of our beloved Mother Mary. As Pope Francis reminds us, Mary, the Mother of God, intercedes for us sinners and guides us on the path to Heaven.

Let us ensure that this sacred song reaches all East Indians, spreading its divine message far and wide. Like and share this profound hymn with your loved ones, allowing them to join in this heartfelt tribute. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for regular updates and to enjoy more beautiful hymns that will touch your soul.

Our heartfelt thanks go to the East Indian Bhavratachi Gaani for this remarkable contribution. Fr. Victor Dalmet lends his voice to this rendition, while the music and recording are skillfully handled by Roney Gomes of Myron Studios, with assistance from Myron Gomes. Join us in celebrating the Feast of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals and the environment, St. Francis of Assisi's life of piety, compassion, and dedication to the poor and marginalized continues to inspire millions worldwide. His legacy endures through the Franciscan Order and the values he cherished, emphasizing the importance of humility, love, and harmony with all of God's creation. St. Francis feast day is celebrated on October 4th, a day that honors his remarkable life and enduring impact on Christianity and the world.

He believed in the equality of all beings and developed a special affinity for animals and the environment, leading to his designation as the patron saint of ecology.

The Novena to the IMMACULATE HEART OF MARY begins today : 16th June, 2022 and we celebrate the feast on 25th June, this year. 
 
The Immaculate Heart of Mary is a highly regarded form of devotion to the bodily heart of Mary, the mother of our Lord. Her life and devotion to her Son and Our Lord, Jesus Christ, inspires Catholics around the world to contemplate and follow in her footsteps.
 
The Immaculate Heart is depicted as a heart pierced with seven wounds or swords, in homage to the seven dolors of Mary, and roses in red or white, wrapped around the heart.
 
The Immaculate Heart of Mary brings about the unification between man and God through her ideas of consecration and reparation. A person who recites novena to the Immaculate Heart of Mary becomes completely devoted to Our God.

"My Immaculate Heart will be your refuge and the way that will lead you to God."
-Our Lady to Lucia

Happy Feast of St. Don Bosco! 

Today, we commemorate the life and legacy of the great St. Don Bosco, the beloved patron saint of youth and students. To honor this special occasion, we invite you to join us in celebrating the remarkable contributions and teachings of this extraordinary saint.

Let us reflect on the words and wisdom of St. Don Bosco as we watch this Hymn. His message of love, kindness, and empowering young minds resonates even today, reminding us of the importance of nurturing the next generation.

A fitting tribute to our Saint, Father, Friend and Teacher of the youth , Don Bosco, who spent his life to make this world a better place. 

St. John Bosco believed that education is a matter of the heart. Even today more than 15000 priests and brothers, living in his spirit, devote themselves to creating an educative environment in which the heart of each young person is opened more fully to God, to others, and to the world. 

The hymn " Bringing his children back to God" is a beautiful composition by Roney Gomes and a beautiful rendition by Mylene and Myron Gomes.

Share this to all your friends and families all over the globe, reaching out the message of love to all. 

May our patron Saint intercede for all of us, especially the youth who have gone astray and guide them back to our Lord.

TRIBUTE TO MOTHER TERESA AND PRINCESS DIANA

Mother Teresa was an inspiration for many people around the world, as she devoted her life to millions of needy and vulnerable people. Her selflessness and service made her a symbol of love, peace and compassion. She won a Nobel Peace Prize in 1979. For her whole life she worked tirelessly for the poor in Kolkata and across the world. Mother Teresa was born in Skopje, in North Macedonia and spent most of her life in India. She started an organization named Missionaries of Charity, for people suffering from HIV/AIDS, leprosy and Tuberculosis. In 1962, she was awarded Ramon Magsaysay for her contribution to the society.

Diana Princess of Wales was the patron and president to multiple charities throughout her life, in which many of the organisations focused on AIDS awareness and prevention, banning the use of landmines, battling poverty and homelessness, various cancer trusts, Leprosy, as well as opening up the stigma surrounding mental illness.

Princess Diana‚Äôs work for charitable causes has become her greatest legacy, forever commemorating her as ‚Äúthe people‚Äôs princess‚Äù.

TRIBUTE TO MOTHER TERESA AND PRINCESS DIANA

Mother Teresa was an inspiration for many people around the world, as she devoted her life to millions of needy and vulnerable people. Her selflessness and service made her a symbol of love, peace and compassion. She won a Nobel Peace Prize in 1979. For her whole life she worked tirelessly for the poor in Kolkata and across the world. Mother Teresa was born in Skopje, in North Macedonia and spent most of her life in India. She started an organization named Missionaries of Charity, for people suffering from HIV/AIDS, leprosy and Tuberculosis. In 1962, she was awarded Ramon Magsaysay for her contribution to the society.

Diana Princess of Wales was the patron and president to multiple charities throughout her life, in which many of the organisations focused on AIDS awareness and prevention, banning the use of landmines, battling poverty and homelessness, various cancer trusts, Leprosy, as well as opening up the stigma surrounding mental illness.

Princess Diana‚Äôs work for charitable causes has become her greatest legacy, forever commemorating her as ‚Äúthe people‚Äôs princess‚Äù.

Happy Feast  Of  Christ, The King

The Feast of Christ the King is a solemnity in the liturgical year that emphasizes the true kingship of Christ. It is celebrated on the last Sunday of the liturgical year, which is the Sunday before the First Sunday of Advent. 

On this day, we remember that Jesus Christ is Lord of the Universe, both as God and as Man . We celebrate His reign over all creation and His victory over sin and death.

May the peace and love of Christ the King be with you and your loved ones on this special day

Wishing you a happy and blessed feast of The Apostle of India, St Thomas. 

The missionary, who was also was one of the Twelve Apostles off India, was born in 1st century A.D. in Galilee, Roman Empire (now Israel) and he was allegedly murdered at St. Thomas Mount, on December 21, 72 A.D. in Mylapore, India. 

After the Resurrection of Jesus Christ, this "Doubting Thomas" only believed that Jesus was with him after inserting his hand into the wound in the Side of Jesus, and said " My Lord and My God "

HAPPY FEAST OF OUR LADY OF MOUNT CARMEL !!!
Carmel Saibini, Bethinichi Rani che besav tumha saglyanvar aso. 

The Blessed Virgin of Mount Carmel has promised to save those who wear the scapular from the fires of hell; She will also shorten their stay in purgatory if they should pass from this world still owing some debt of punishment. 

Pope Paul VI, speaking of Marian devotions, especially of the Scapular, says ‚ÄúLet the faithful hold in high esteem the practices and devotions to the Blessed Virgin approved by the teaching authority of the Church. It is Our conviction that the Rosary of Mary and the Scapular of Carmel are among these recommended practices. The Scapular is a practice of piety, which by its very simplicity is suited to everyone.‚Äù

Let us all promise to wear the brown scapular everyday. True devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary consists in three things: VENERATION, CONFIDENCE AND LOVE. By simply wearing the Scapular, we can tell her every moment of the day that we venerate her, love her and trust in her protection.

HAPPY FEAST OF OUR LADY OF MOUNT CARMEL !!!
Carmel Saibini, Bethinichi Rani che besav tumha saglyanvar aso. 

The Blessed Virgin of Mount Carmel has promised to save those who wear the scapular from the fires of hell; She will also shorten their stay in purgatory if they should pass from this world still owing some debt of punishment. 

Pope Paul VI, speaking of Marian devotions, especially of the Scapular, says ‚ÄúLet the faithful hold in high esteem the practices and devotions to the Blessed Virgin approved by the teaching authority of the Church. It is Our conviction that the Rosary of Mary and the Scapular of Carmel are among these recommended practices. The Scapular is a practice of piety, which by its very simplicity is suited to everyone.‚Äù

Let us all promise to wear the brown scapular everyday. True devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary consists in three things: VENERATION, CONFIDENCE AND LOVE. By simply wearing the Scapular, we can tell her every moment of the day that we venerate her, love her and trust in her protection.

"TOH MI NAI"

THE CHILDREN OF LATE THOMAS PEREIRA DEDICATE THIS SONG "TOH MI NAI" TO THEIR LATE MATERNAL UNCLE, GILBERT MISQUITTA OF GOWARI / WADALA ON HIS 63RD DEATH ANNIVERSARY 

‚ÄúTOH MI NAI ‚Äù   COMPOSED BY : LATE THOMAS PEREIRA - ASLI HEERA 

This Duet was sung by Late Thomas Pereira and his Late Brother in Law Gilbert Misquitta in 1959.

With this song, Gilbert was being introduced to the East Indian Competition Stage. He passed away in a month's time after singing this song. Hence this particular song was considered a bad omen and was dumped.Gilbert was doing the female part in which he had a line to sing ‚ÄúKHALLAS KELIS RE MAJI DUNIYAN‚Äù

Happy Feast of St. Sebastian !

"Wishing you a blessed and joyful Feast of St. Sebastian! May the grace and strength of the martyr guide you on your journey"
---------------------------------------------

St. Sebastian was a Christian martyr who is remembered for his faith and courage. He is believed to have lived in the 3rd century AD, during the Roman Empire. He is the patron saint of athletes and soldiers, and his feast day is celebrated on January 20th in the Catholic Church.

According to tradition, St. Sebastian was a captain in the Roman army and a secret Christian. When Emperor Diocletian discovered Sebastian's faith, he ordered him to be tied to a stake and shot with arrows. Miraculously, Sebastian survived the execution and was later visited by Saint Irene, who nursed him back to health. However, when Sebastian confronted the emperor and denounced his persecution of Christians, he was clubbed to death.

St. Sebastian is often depicted in art as a handsome young man tied to a tree or stake, and pierced by arrows. His iconography is usually associated with arrows and bows, and he is also depicted as a soldier. He is venerated as a martyr and a protector against plague and disease, and his intercession is invoked for the protection of soldiers and athletes.

The cult of St. Sebastian was very popular throughout the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, and he remains a beloved saint in the Catholic Church today. His feast day is celebrated on January 20th, and many churches, shrines and chapels are dedicated to him around the world.

Happy Feast Of Christ, The King !!!

The Feast of Christ the King is a solemnity in the liturgical year that emphasizes the true kingship of Christ. It is celebrated on the last Sunday of the liturgical year, which is the Sunday before the First Sunday of Advent. 

On this day, we remember that Jesus Christ is Lord of the Universe, both as God and as Man . We celebrate His reign over all creation and His victory over sin and death.

May the peace and love of Christ the King be with you and your loved ones on this special day

Happy Feast  Of  Christ, The King

The Feast of Christ the King is a solemnity in the liturgical year that emphasizes the true kingship of Christ. It is celebrated on the last Sunday of the liturgical year, which is the Sunday before the First Sunday of Advent. 

On this day, we remember that Jesus Christ is Lord of the Universe, both as God and as Man . We celebrate His reign over all creation and His victory over sin and death.

May the peace and love of Christ the King be with you and your loved ones on this special day

Happy Feast of St. Dominic Savio!!!

Dominic Savio is referred to as a saint "small in size, but a towering giant in spirit."

Don Bosco's talk on sainthood. had three main points that impressed Dominic:

That it is God's will that each one should become a saint.

That it is easy to become a saint.

That there is a great reward waiting in heaven for those who try to become saints.

This inspired Dominic to take a conscious decision to become a saint.

It‚Äôs easy to be a Saint."  Don Bosco taught his Salesians and the young people , "Do the ordinary things in an extraordinary way." 

Let's learn more about one of the youngest saint, Dominic Savio.

It serves to give collective thanks for His abiding presence, instruct us in the Mystery, Faith, and devotion of the Eucharist, and encourage us to embrace this precious gift. We honor God's enduring love as we partake in His body and blood, allowing it to nourish and transform us. May this feast deepen our understanding, strengthen our faith, and foster unity.

https://youtu.be/PMUj_Qod7gI
On this joyous Feast of the Nativity of Our Blessed Mother, let us come together to celebrate with a traditional East Indian hymn brought to you by Image. This hymn holds a special place in the hearts of our East Indian community, often sung during family gatherings, community events, and grotto rosaries, particularly during the novenas dedicated to the Nativity of Our Blessed Mother. Its melodious verses resonate with the spirit of devotion and love.

For the first time ever, we present to you the complete hymn, "Vailankanni Saibini Aamchi," in East Indian Marathi, comprising five verses. Each verse can be sung after each decade of the Holy Rosary, adding a spiritual dimension to your prayers. The video includes the lyrics so that you can sing along and immerse yourself in the beauty of this sacred hymn.

Our mission is to ensure that this divine song reaches all East Indians. We kindly ask you to like and share this hymn with your near and dear ones. By doing so, we can unite our community in celebration and spread the message of love and devotion to Our Blessed Mother. Remember to subscribe to our channel for regular updates and to enjoy more exquisite hymns.

Let us embrace the creativity and power of this message, coming together as one to honor and celebrate the birth of Our Blessed Mother. May her love and intercession guide us on our spiritual journey. Join us in spreading the joy of this hymn and deepen your connection with the divine.

HAPPY FEAST OF OUR LADY OF MOUNT CARMEL !!!
Carmel Saibini, Bethinichi Rani che besav tumha saglyanvar aso. 

The Blessed Virgin of Mount Carmel has promised to save those who wear the scapular from the fires of hell; She will also shorten their stay in purgatory if they should pass from this world still owing some debt of punishment. 

Pope Paul VI, speaking of Marian devotions, especially of the Scapular, says ‚ÄúLet the faithful hold in high esteem the practices and devotions to the Blessed Virgin approved by the teaching authority of the Church. It is Our conviction that the Rosary of Mary and the Scapular of Carmel are among these recommended practices. The Scapular is a practice of piety, which by its very simplicity is suited to everyone.‚Äù

Let us all promise to wear the brown scapular everyday. True devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary consists in three things: VENERATION, CONFIDENCE AND LOVE. By simply wearing the Scapular, we can tell her every moment of the day that we venerate her, love her and trust in her protection.

---------------------------------------------
A TRIBUTE TO OUR EAST INDIAN LEGEND :  BONNY CREADO ON HIS  DEATH ANNIVERSARY.
---------------------------------------------
EAST INDIAN SONGS AND COMPETITIONS HAVE BEEN AN INSEPARABLE PART OF OUR EAST INDIAN COMMUNITY OF MOBAI'S RICH CULTURE AND TRADITIONS. MANY SINGERS HAVE BEEN A PART OF THIS TRADITION. BUT SOME OF THE SINGERS HAD MUSIC IN THEIR BLOOD.  

LATE BONNY CREADO THE LEGENDARY EAST INDIAN SINGER OF THE YESTERYEARS, WHO HAILED FROM JUHU, IS FONDLY REMEMBERED AS ONE OF THE GREAT SINGERS WHO RULED THE EAST INDIAN SINGING COMPETITIONS, DURING THE LATE SIXTIES AND EARLY SEVENTIES. HE WAS KNOWN TO BE THE FASTEST COMPOSER OF SONGS

BONNY CREADO was one angle of equal value of pentagon ruling the East Indian cultural stage during that era, among  THOMAS PEREIRA, ANTHONY PEREIRA,  J. D'SOUZA (‡§ù‡•Ç‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ) AND J. D'CUNAH. 

Unfortunately, his life candle extinguished abruptly midway, on 18th July 1972 , depriving his fans of the musical  treat that he had to offer. 

The entire singing fraternity was aghast with the news of his death.

WE THANK THIS LEGEND FOR HIS INVALUABLE CONTRIBUTION TO THE EAST INDIAN MUSIC INDUSTRY

Happy Feast of St. Don Bosco! 

Today, we commemorate the life and legacy of the great St. Don Bosco, the beloved patron saint of youth and students. To honor this special occasion, we invite you to join us in celebrating the remarkable contributions and teachings of this extraordinary saint.

Let us reflect on the words and wisdom of St. Don Bosco as we watch this Hymn. His message of love, kindness, and empowering young minds resonates even today, reminding us of the importance of nurturing the next generation.

A fitting tribute to our Saint, Father, Friend and Teacher of the youth , Don Bosco, who spent his life to make this world a better place. 

St. John Bosco believed that education is a matter of the heart. Even today more than 15000 priests and brothers, living in his spirit, devote themselves to creating an educative environment in which the heart of each young person is opened more fully to God, to others, and to the world. 

The hymn " Bringing his children back to God" is a beautiful composition by Roney Gomes and a beautiful rendition by Mylene and Myron Gomes.

Share this to all your friends and families all over the globe, reaching out the message of love to all. 

May our patron Saint intercede for all of us, especially the youth who have gone astray and guide them back to our Lord.

Happy Feast of St. Francis of Assisi!

Join us in celebrating the Feast of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals and the environment, St. Francis of Assisi's life of piety, compassion, and dedication to the poor and marginalized continues to inspire millions worldwide. His legacy endures through the Franciscan Order and the values he cherished, emphasizing the importance of humility, love, and harmony with all of God's creation. St. Francis feast day is celebrated on October 4th, a day that honors his remarkable life and enduring impact on Christianity and the world.

He believed in the equality of all beings and developed a special affinity for animals and the environment, leading to his designation as the patron saint of ecology.

Carmel Saibini, Bethinichi Rani che besav tumha saglyanvar aso. 

The Blessed Virgin of Mount Carmel has promised to save those who wear the scapular from the fires of hell; She will also shorten their stay in purgatory if they should pass from this world still owing some debt of punishment. 

Pope Paul VI, speaking of Marian devotions, especially of the Scapular, says ‚ÄúLet the faithful hold in high esteem the practices and devotions to the Blessed Virgin approved by the teaching authority of the Church. It is Our conviction that the Rosary of Mary and the Scapular of Carmel are among these recommended practices. The Scapular is a practice of piety, which by its very simplicity is suited to everyone.‚Äù

Let us all promise to wear the brown scapular everyday. True devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary consists in three things: VENERATION, CONFIDENCE AND LOVE. By simply wearing the Scapular, we can tell her every moment of the day that we venerate her, love her and trust in her protection.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist !!!

The Nativity of John the Baptist on June 24 comes three months after the celebration on March 25 of the Annunciation, when the angel Gabriel told Mary that her cousin Elizabeth was in her sixth month of pregnancy, and six months before the Christmas celebration of the birth of Jesus. The purpose of these festivals is not to celebrate the exact dates of these events, but simply to commemorate them in an interlinking way. The Nativity of John the Baptist anticipates the feast of Christmas.

What makes this feast even more remarkable is that John the Baptist is one of the few saints whose birthday is celebrated. Alongside Jesus and Mary, John holds a unique place in our hearts and in the liturgical calendar. While most saints' feasts are observed on the days of their death, John's birth is celebrated with joy and reverence.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist

Bhagivanta Sant  John Baptist
Courtesy: St. Michael Church, Manickpur

On this joyous Feast of the Nativity of Our Blessed Mother, let us come together to celebrate with a traditional East Indian hymn brought to you by Image. This hymn holds a special place in the hearts of our East Indian community, often sung during family gatherings, community events, and grotto rosaries, particularly during the novenas dedicated to the Nativity of Our Blessed Mother. Its melodious verses resonate with the spirit of devotion and love.

For the first time ever, we present to you the complete hymn, "Vailankanni Saibini Aamchi," in East Indian Marathi, comprising five verses. Each verse can be sung after each decade of the Holy Rosary, adding a spiritual dimension to your prayers. The video includes the lyrics so that you can sing along and immerse yourself in the beauty of this sacred hymn.

Our mission is to ensure that this divine song reaches all East Indians. We kindly ask you to like and share this hymn with your near and dear ones. By doing so, we can unite our community in celebration and spread the message of love and devotion to Our Blessed Mother. Remember to subscribe to our channel for regular updates and to enjoy more exquisite hymns.

Let us embrace the creativity and power of this message, coming together as one to honor and celebrate the birth of Our Blessed Mother. May her love and intercession guide us on our spiritual journey. Join us in spreading the joy of this hymn and deepen your connection with the divine.

Wishing You All A Blessed Feast Of Our Lady Of Sorrows

The Memorial of Our Lady of Sorrows commemorates the seven sorrows in the Heart of Mary as recorded in Scripture:

1) The prophecy of Simeon ( Luke 2:33‚Äì35 )
2) The flight into Egypt ( Matthew 2:13‚Äì15 )
3) Loss of the Child Jesus for three days ( Luke 2:41‚Äì50 )
4) Mary meets Jesus on His way to Calvary ( Luke 23:27‚Äì31; John 19:17 )
5) Crucifixion and Death of Jesus ( John 19:25‚Äì30 )
6) The body of Jesus being taken from the Cross ( Luke 23:50‚Äì54; John 19:31‚Äì37 )
7) The burial of Jesus ( Isaiah 53:8‚Äì9; Luke 23:50‚Äì56; John 19:38‚Äì42; Mark 15:40‚Äì47 )

Happy Feast of St. Francis of Assisi!

Join us in celebrating the Feast of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals and the environment, St. Francis of Assisi's life of piety, compassion, and dedication to the poor and marginalized continues to inspire millions worldwide. His legacy endures through the Franciscan Order and the values he cherished, emphasizing the importance of humility, love, and harmony with all of God's creation. St. Francis feast day is celebrated on October 4th, a day that honors his remarkable life and enduring impact on Christianity and the world.

He believed in the equality of all beings and developed a special affinity for animals and the environment, leading to his designation as the patron saint of ecology.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist !!!

The Nativity of John the Baptist on June 24 comes three months after the celebration on March 25 of the Annunciation, when the angel Gabriel told Mary that her cousin Elizabeth was in her sixth month of pregnancy, and six months before the Christmas celebration of the birth of Jesus. The purpose of these festivals is not to celebrate the exact dates of these events, but simply to commemorate them in an interlinking way. The Nativity of John the Baptist anticipates the feast of Christmas.

What makes this feast even more remarkable is that John the Baptist is one of the few saints whose birthday is celebrated. Alongside Jesus and Mary, John holds a unique place in our hearts and in the liturgical calendar. While most saints' feasts are observed on the days of their death, John's birth is celebrated with joy and reverence.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist

Bhagivanta Sant  John Baptist
Courtesy: St. Michael Church, Manickpur

TRIBUTE TO MOTHER TERESA AND PRINCESS DIANA

Mother Teresa was an inspiration for many people around the world, as she devoted her life to millions of needy and vulnerable people. Her selflessness and service made her a symbol of love, peace and compassion. She won a Nobel Peace Prize in 1979. For her whole life she worked tirelessly for the poor in Kolkata and across the world. Mother Teresa was born in Skopje, in North Macedonia and spent most of her life in India. She started an organization named Missionaries of Charity, for people suffering from HIV/AIDS, leprosy and Tuberculosis. In 1962, she was awarded Ramon Magsaysay for her contribution to the society.

Diana Princess of Wales was the patron and president to multiple charities throughout her life, in which many of the organisations focused on AIDS awareness and prevention, banning the use of landmines, battling poverty and homelessness, various cancer trusts, Leprosy, as well as opening up the stigma surrounding mental illness.

Princess Diana‚Äôs work for charitable causes has become her greatest legacy, forever commemorating her as ‚Äúthe people‚Äôs princess‚Äù.

LATE BONNY CREADO THE LEGENDARY EAST INDIAN SINGER OF THE YESTERYEARS, WHO HAILED FROM JUHU, IS FONDLY REMEMBERED AS ONE OF THE GREAT SINGERS WHO RULED THE EAST INDIAN SINGING COMPETITIONS, DURING THE LATE SIXTIES AND EARLY SEVENTIES. HE WAS KNOWN TO BE THE FASTEST COMPOSER OF SONGS

Happy Feast of St. Sebastian !

"Wishing you a blessed and joyful Feast of St. Sebastian! May the grace and strength of the martyr guide you on your journey"
---------------------------------------------

St. Sebastian was a Christian martyr who is remembered for his faith and courage. He is believed to have lived in the 3rd century AD, during the Roman Empire. He is the patron saint of athletes and soldiers, and his feast day is celebrated on January 20th in the Catholic Church.

According to tradition, St. Sebastian was a captain in the Roman army and a secret Christian. When Emperor Diocletian discovered Sebastian's faith, he ordered him to be tied to a stake and shot with arrows. Miraculously, Sebastian survived the execution and was later visited by Saint Irene, who nursed him back to health. However, when Sebastian confronted the emperor and denounced his persecution of Christians, he was clubbed to death.

St. Sebastian is often depicted in art as a handsome young man tied to a tree or stake, and pierced by arrows. His iconography is usually associated with arrows and bows, and he is also depicted as a soldier. He is venerated as a martyr and a protector against plague and disease, and his intercession is invoked for the protection of soldiers and athletes.

The cult of St. Sebastian was very popular throughout the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, and he remains a beloved saint in the Catholic Church today. His feast day is celebrated on January 20th, and many churches, shrines and chapels are dedicated to him around the world.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist !!!

The Nativity of John the Baptist on June 24 comes three months after the celebration on March 25 of the Annunciation, when the angel Gabriel told Mary that her cousin Elizabeth was in her sixth month of pregnancy, and six months before the Christmas celebration of the birth of Jesus. The purpose of these festivals is not to celebrate the exact dates of these events, but simply to commemorate them in an interlinking way. The Nativity of John the Baptist anticipates the feast of Christmas.

What makes this feast even more remarkable is that John the Baptist is one of the few saints whose birthday is celebrated. Alongside Jesus and Mary, John holds a unique place in our hearts and in the liturgical calendar. While most saints' feasts are observed on the days of their death, John's birth is celebrated with joy and reverence.

Happy Feast Of St. John The Baptist

Bhagivanta Sant  John Baptist
